messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tv program
messages.msgSnippet: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tv programI wished I could get a transcript/tape of the show, I d love to know exactly what was said ... most of the other comments
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tv program
I wished I could get a transcript/tape of the show, I'd love to know exactly what was said ... most of the other comments I've heard have been positive but they (media) always bring up that *S* (SOCIALIZATION) issue ... yeh, right like those p-s'rs are the SOCIALIZED ones, ha, just turn on the evening news people, HELLO???   
 
I agree w/ your statement about h-s'rs being friendly ... I don't believe I've ever met a h-s'r (we're very active in our h-s community, so I've met a lot of h-s'rs) who can't carry on a decent conversation w/ an adult!!!  they make eye contact, share ideas, have tons of clever ideas about how the world clicks along but I don't think I can say the same thing about most of the p-s'rs I know ... it's been my experience that p-s'rs will usually look @ the ground or above an adults head but rarely make direct eye contact ... wonder why???  ***SOCIALIZATION*** MAYBE??? 
 
OH AMY, my stars above!!!  you've been h-s'ing little Accalia for the past year but you just don't realized it; little babies learn from the get~go and I'm sure you're doing a beautiful job w/ your little munchkin @ that <G> :)
Pris
----- Original Message -----
From: CA Nelson
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Sunday, June 25, 2000 4:06 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tv program

Pris-
   I didn't catch all of it, but I never know exactly what to think about homeschooling shows like this since I'm not actually doing it now. I love, though, how the h'sing kids they interviewed are always to friendly and knowledgeable and never come across as defensive (in a bad way) about their schooling.

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls


... several of h-s loops have really been buzzing about this show, I wished I would've known to @ least tape it; drats ...

messages.subject: tv program
messages.msgSnippet: Re: apology/tv program ... several of h-s loops have really been buzzing about this show, I wished I would ve known to @ least tape it; drats ... Pris On
messages.messageBody:
Re: apology/tv program
 
... several of h-s loops have really been buzzing about this show, I wished I would've known to @ least tape it; drats ...
 
Pris
 
On another note, did anyone catch the segment on homeschooling on CBS Sunday Morning? It featured a family in New Hampshire and a group in Virginia. Of course one of the main arguments was that there wasn't enough interaction with people of different views. Hmm, so in ps every student is allowed to explore a different viewpoint other than what teachers are required to teach? Just curious what others thought.

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
